attributes.action: Reduce the waiting period to join the army
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The waiting period to join the army is 10 years for an ex offender who committed the offense(s) over the age of 18 at the time.
For someone who committed an offense and was convicted below 18 years of age has to wait 5 years.

We believe it to be wrong for a younger person to have to wait 5 years before he/she can apply for committing an offense and being convicted because the offense was committed at such a young age.
People grow up and learn from there mistakes especially around this age group so we deem it unfair that they still have to wait 5 years from the time of being convicted.
The same wait applies to every type of crime committed and if the individual has spent 6 months - 12 months in a Y.O.I
